subject: Learning
title: The Role of the Hippocampus
description: Learn The Role of the Hippocampus in one minute.

hook.text: A man named H.M. had his hippocampus removed. He could never form a new memory again.

buildup.text: The hippocampus is a seahorse-shaped structure deep in each brain hemisphere.

discovery.text: It acts as a temporary workspace, binding pieces of an experience into one memory.

twist.text: But it doesn't store memories forever. Over time, it transfers them to the cortex.

climax.text: Damage the hippocampus and old memories survive, but new ones never form.

punchline.text: The hippocampus builds memories. The cortex keeps them.

quiz.question: What is the hippocampus's role in memory?
options: It binds new experiences into memories temporarily
